title: Senior Data Analyst
description: At Kerry Properties, we commit to employing people who are passionate and dedicated. We look for people who always strive for excellence and possess a positive attitude. In turn, we offer our people boundless opportunities in career advancement and realization of their potential. Job Highlights: Senior data visualization analyst is a technical expert in different visualization projects in Kerry. In this role, you will intensively involve in inhouse report and dashboard design, development, and deployment. You will be responsible for the maintenance and support of the visualization platform serving multiple business unites' visualization needs. Responsibilities: Work with business stakeholders to create and publish Business Intelligent dashboards using Tableau or other visualization reporting tools- from ideation to Proof-of-Concept design, to publishing the final product Curate data from multiple disparate sources and develop strategies for standardizing and consolidating data sets across the business Provide training, guidance, and coaching to business users with company visualization & reporting tool Manage multiple projects / deadlines, identifying the critical path and moving forward through completion Analyzing and modelling data to unlock key insights - Partnering with key business stakeholders to support their analytical and reporting needs Automating manual processes to provide robust reporting workflow Self-management with adapts and leading the team to change in routine with positive attitude when working in fast paced situations Maintain regular communication and escalation channels to both business and technical owners Co-ordinate daily visualization platform support and operation Requirements: Degree holder in Information Technology, Computer Science or related disciplines 2 to 3 Years' experience with advanced features of Tableau, such as Level-Of-Detail, data blending, data story Proficient in using Oracle PL/SQL in both transactional and data warehouse environments Demonstrate data visualization best practice Ability to troubleshoot performance and data quality issues Good communication skills and be a proactive team player (Preferred) Tableau certified specialist The personal data provided will only be used for recruitment and employment-related purposes. All personal data provided will be treated in strict confidence. All applications may be considered for other suitable position(s) in the Kuok/Kerry Group and its subsidiary/ associated companies. For correction of or access to personal data after submission of the application or enquiries on recruitment matters, please contact Human Resources Department by email to hr.talentacquisition@kerryprops.com. Please mark "Confidential: Personal Data Access/ Correction/ Recruitment Enquiries" on your correspondence. Information on unsuccessful candidates will normally be destroyed after 24 months from the date of application. By submitting an application through Kerry Properties' Career webpage, you are deemed to have consented to its Personal Information Collection Statement.

title: Technology - Data Analyst/ Consultant

Communicate with engineers to transform data models to data products. (multiple headcounts) Familiarity with visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau Knowledge in SQL, NoSQL, Python, R, Databricks, etc. Sound knowledge in Business and Data requirement analysis Understanding of SDLC and data modeling methodologies is a plus Strong interpersonal skills and able to communicate with both local and regional team Strong presentation and communication skills in English Why join us? We offer a transparent, fast paced approach career progression, with a focus on your strengths and continuous coaching from senior colleagues You will benefit from working alongside Accenture experts who are solving some of the biggest industry challenges with innovative thinking and pioneering tools Flexible work arrangements and a range of benefits including competitive rewards You will have access to state-of-the-art technology that will give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest business trends You will also have opportunities to make a difference to the communities in which we work and live If you have not received a response within a month, please understand that your application for this position has not been successful.

title: Data Analyst
description: We are seeking a talented professional to support and drive the integration of AI, machine learning, and data-driven solutions into our engineering design workflows. The successful candidate will leverage tools such as Python, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, and LLMs, along with computer vision techniques, to develop innovative in-house software solutions. Key Responsibilities Design, develop, and implement machine learning models using libraries such as Scikit-learn and PyTorch to optimize design workflows and project outcomes. Build and deploy AI-driven tools, including Large Language Models (LLMs) for chatbots computer vision systems for image recognition, to support engineers for design validation, site monitoring, and automation. Write clean, efficient, and maintainable Python code to integrate AI solutions into existing workflows and in-house software platforms. Collaborate with engineers to understand project requirements, translate technical needs into data-driven solutions, and provide actionable insights. Develop and maintain database structures (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) to store and manage project-related data effectively. Analyze datasets from infrastructure projects to identify patterns, improve decision-making, and enhance design efficiency. Stay updated on emerging AI technologies and propose innovative applications. Support the development of in-house software tools by providing technical expertise and ensuring seamless integration with engineering processes. Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including management team and engineers, in a clear and concise manner. Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, machine learning, or software development, preferably in an engineering or construction context. Proficiency in Python, with hands-on experience using Scikit-learn, PyTorch, or similar ML and deep learning frameworks. Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) and computer vision techniques for applications such as image recognition or object detection Strong understanding of database design and management, e.g. SQL, MongoDB, or similar platform. Experience with cloud platforms, e.g. AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, for deploying AI models and managing data pipelines. Experience with software development practices, including version control, e.g. Git and collaborative coding. Passion for innovation and a proactive approach to applying AI and data science in real-world infrastructure challenges. Knowledge of construction or infrastructure project, including CAD / BIM design workflows is a plus but not mandatory. Fluency in English with proficiency in Cantonese or Mandarin is advantageous. Interested parties are invited to send full resume stating reference code, availability, present and expected salaries and daytime contact telephone number by clicking “Quick Apply”. Applicants not being informed of any interview arrangement within 6 weeks from your date of application may assume your application not successful. Personal information contained in applications received will be used for employment-related purposes and, in respect of the successful appointee only, also for business-related purposes.

Your Role Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicators and provide actionable insights Utilize SQL (preferably Oracle SQL) to query and manipulate data from various databases and data sources for in-depth analysis Perform advanced data analysis using SQL to uncover patterns, trends, and anomalies in the data Work closely with system analysts and business stakeholders to align technical solutions with business requirements Identify opportunities for process improvement and data-driven decision-making through SQL analysis Collaborate with the Data Warehouse team to ensure data quality and integrity in the analysis process Bridge the gap between technical solutions and business requirements by effectively communicating SQL analysis results to stakeholders To Succeed in this Role Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization Strong proficiency in SQL, with hands-on experience in Oracle SQL preferred Familiarity with Data Warehouse concepts and methodologies Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy and quality Demonstrated expertise in using SQL for data analysis and reporting If you have a passion for leveraging data to drive business decisions, possess the necessary skills and experience, and excel at using SQL for analysis, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity as a Data Analyst with our team.

title: LLM Engineer (Data and Optimization)
company_name: TCL Corporate Research (Hong Kong) Co., Limited
description: Job Description As a Large Model Algorithm Engineer, you will focus on the technical research and development of Large Language Models (LLMs) and multimodal large models, driving their application in industrial vertical domains. You will participate in core processes such as model training, optimization, and inference deployment while collaborating with top university research teams to explore cutting-edge technologies and improve model performance and efficiency. Key Responsibilities Responsible for training, fine-tuning (SFT), and system deployment of vertical domain large models, promoting efficient application of large models in industrial environments. Research and implement compression and optimization techniques for large models, including pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation, to improve inference efficiency and deployment performance. Participate in the algorithm design and development of RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and Agent modules to enhance reasoning capabilities in dynamic and complex environments. Research and apply multimodal understanding technologies to optimize the application of Large Vision Models (LVM) in industrial vision and other fields. Translate business rules into efficient workflow code and participate in the design and implementation of Agentic Workflow to enhance workflow intelligence. Build industry datasets to support large model training and applications, including data preprocessing, pretraining data construction, and training/application/evaluation dataset setup. Research and implement large model merging techniques, exploring collaborative optimization solutions for multiple models. Develop and maintain validation, evaluation, and performance monitoring processes for large models to ensure system stability and usability. Participate in the development and optimization of large model application platforms (microservices) to enhance system modularity and usability. Qualifications Master’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field is preferred. Proficient in machine learning, deep learning, and Transformer architecture, with hands-on experience in end-to-end training and development of large models. Familiar with large model compression and optimization methods such as pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation. Strong capabilities in large-scale data processing and familiarity with big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark), with experience in data preprocessing, cleaning, and building training datasets. Skilled in Python, C/C++, and Linux programming, with a solid foundation in algorithms and data structures. Familiar with mainstream large model training and inference frameworks such as PyTorch, Hugging Face (HF), DeepSpeed, PEFT, vLLM, TRL, etc. Knowledge of Triton or other high-performance inference tools, with experience in applying model optimization to real-world deployments. Proficient in Docker and Linux shell scripting; experience with FastAPI development is a plus. Experience in enterprise-level large model development, optimization, deployment, and tool development is preferred. Strong teamwork and communication skills, capable of collaborating with cross-domain teams. Passionate about cutting-edge large model technologies and their applications in industrial vertical domains. Bonus Points Experience in RAG systems and Agent module development and optimization. Familiarity with CUDA programming, distributed computing, or related high-performance computing technologies. Publications in top-tier conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICLR, CVPR). Knowledge of hardware acceleration technologies (e.g., GPU, TPU) and their applications in model optimization.

title: ANALYST – Business Intelligence and Investigations
description: HONG KONG LSR unearths commercial information and provides advice on low-profile companies in Asia, the Middle East and beyond. Our 30 years of specialist experience is trusted by lawyers and claims handlers. LSR listens to the details, understands what is needed and gets practical results. When you join our team, you’ll discover a mutually supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to attain a work-life balance. An exciting opening brings the chance to learn from world-renowned specialists, contribute and grow, based on your interest and expertise. You’ll be joining in the new adventure as we expand out from our Hong Kong roots. Do you like Jigsaw Puzzles? We give our clients incisive knowledge so that they can make smarter decisions – specifically we provide in-depth reports on companies acting in sectors, or geographic regions, that do not normally provide much publicly accessible information (for example international shipping, commodity trading, offshore registrations, “brass-plate” corporations). It is our job to provide a real-world picture – we identify what pieces of the information jigsaw are easily available and we get them. We then decide what pieces we are missing and go out and find them. Our international clients (including top 4 accountancy firms, oil majors, international law firms, shipping companies and insurers) would be operating in an information vacuum without us. What would you get? Real-world research methodology A deep knowledge of international trade from macro trade flows to individual transactions Experience in insurance and maritime practice, trade finance, international trade documents and commercial transactions Supportive team Who would suit this job? Someone who knows (or who wants to know) how the world works. Someone who can construct a theoretical P&L and Balance Sheet from operational data. A pragmatist, detail orientated but still retaining a big picture perspective. Successful colleagues have backgrounds from accountancy, academia, shipping operations and insurance but each shares the key personality traits of an enquiring mind, doggedness, deductive reasoning skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills and an interest in world affairs. JOB SCOPE After a period of training, undertake research projects on companies in various industries (shipping, trading, mining, finance, construction etc.) Make phone enquiries with local sources around the world. Communicate with Clients to provide timelines and project updates on a consistent basis. Write and submit detailed and accurate reports on projects in English/ Chinese within specific time periods, and with real-world commercial consequences. Maintain internal databases and explore new sources. Occasional after-hours participation in networking activities. QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE Degree level or equivalent professional qualification. Language - Mandarin and Strong to excellent written and spoken English as Chinese information sources are typically examined and the reports are produced in English. Knowledge in credit research or journalism is highly preferred. Preferably with 2 to 4 years of experience in accounting/auditing; media or journalism; shipping background with commercial, client-facing experience such as broking, chartering etc. Applications from other relevant sectors such as risk management will be also considered. On-the-job training, medical insurance, competitive remuneration, visa extension, study advancement support will be offered. Work on weekdays only. Interested parties please email your resumé and a cover letter to us. Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Please feel free to contact us by phone at +852 25370090.

We are looking forward to hearing from you. We will get back to you as soon as possible! Company Overview With our professional consulting service, ARIC has been a reliable partner for successful business in Asia for more than 10 years. We are based in the flourishing and multifaceted Munich metropolitan area, the location of numerous global players and mid-market hidden champions. What we share with our customers is our common interest in East and South- East Asia. We are convinced that business success in Asia requires profound market and regional knowledge. For uncertainty and lack of knowledge are the biggest risks for success in business. We help our clients to analyze growth markets and economic trends in the region to reduce risk. We offer our services to small and medium-sized German companies with tailor-made business research on topics such as: • Market potential and risk analyses • Competitor analysis and due diligence • Monitoring economic trends & policy • Supply chain management & diversification For further information visit our website at www.aric-invest.de

title: LLM Engineer (Data and Optimization)
company_name: TCL Corporate Research (Hong Kong) Co., Limited
description: Job Description As a Large Model Algorithm Engineer, you will focus on the technical research and development of Large Language Models (LLMs) and multimodal large models, driving their application in industrial vertical domains. You will participate in core processes such as model training, optimization, and inference deployment while collaborating with top university research teams to explore cutting-edge technologies and improve model performance and efficiency. Key Responsibilities Responsible for training, fine-tuning (SFT), and system deployment of vertical domain large models, promoting efficient application of large models in industrial environments. Research and implement compression and optimization techniques for large models, including pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation, to improve inference efficiency and deployment performance. Participate in the algorithm design and development of RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and Agent modules to enhance reasoning capabilities in dynamic and complex environments. Research and apply multimodal understanding technologies to optimize the application of Large Vision Models (LVM) in industrial vision and other fields. Translate business rules into efficient workflow code and participate in the design and implementation of Agentic Workflow to enhance workflow intelligence. Build industry datasets to support large model training and applications, including data preprocessing, pretraining data construction, and training/application/evaluation dataset setup. Research and implement large model merging techniques, exploring collaborative optimization solutions for multiple models. Develop and maintain validation, evaluation, and performance monitoring processes for large models to ensure system stability and usability. Participate in the development and optimization of large model application platforms (microservices) to enhance system modularity and usability. Qualifications Master’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field is preferred. Proficient in machine learning, deep learning, and Transformer architecture, with hands-on experience in end-to-end training and development of large models. Familiar with large model compression and optimization methods such as pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation. Strong capabilities in large-scale data processing and familiarity with big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark), with experience in data preprocessing, cleaning, and building training datasets. Skilled in Python, C/C++, and Linux programming, with a solid foundation in algorithms and data structures. Familiar with mainstream large model training and inference frameworks such as PyTorch, Hugging Face (HF), DeepSpeed, PEFT, vLLM, TRL, etc. Knowledge of Triton or other high-performance inference tools, with experience in applying model optimization to real-world deployments. Proficient in Docker and Linux shell scripting; experience with FastAPI development is a plus. Experience in enterprise-level large model development, optimization, deployment, and tool development is preferred. Strong teamwork and communication skills, capable of collaborating with cross-domain teams. Passionate about cutting-edge large model technologies and their applications in industrial vertical domains. Bonus Points Experience in RAG systems and Agent module development and optimization. Familiarity with CUDA programming, distributed computing, or related high-performance computing technologies. Publications in top-tier conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICLR, CVPR). Knowledge of hardware acceleration technologies (e.g., GPU, TPU) and their applications in model optimization.
